titles.title: A bill to designate the United States Federal Building and Courthouse in Detroit, Michigan, as the "Theodore Levin Federal Building and Courthouse", and for other purposes.
An act to designate the United States Courthouse in Detroit, Michigan, as the "Theodore Levin Courthouse", and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S11901)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Baucus with amendments and an amendment to the title. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 661.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Traficant asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/30/1994--Passed Senate amended. Designates the courthouse facility located at 231 West Lafayette in Detroit, Michigan, as the Theodore Levin Courthouse.
